name: jshint
description: Integrates JSHint into VS Code. JSHint is a linter for JavaScript
author: Microsoft Corporation

jshint.enable.description: Control whether or not jshint is enabled for JavaScript files.

jshint.config.description: A path to file containing the configuration options for jshint. If the file exists it overrides jshint.options and any .jshintrc file

bitwise.description: Prohibit the use of bitwise operators (&, |, ^, etc.)

curly.description: Requires you to always put curly braces around blocks in loops and conditionals

eqeqeq.description: Prohibits the use of `==` and `!=` in favor of `===` and `!==`

esversion.description: The ECMAScript version to which the code must adhere

forin.description: Requires all `for in` loops to filter object's items with obj.hasOwnProperty()

freeze.description: Prohibits overwriting prototypes of native objects such as Array, Date and so on

funcscope.description: Suppresses warnings about declaring variables inside of control structures while accessing them later from the outside

futurehostile.description: Enables warnings about the use of identifiers which are defined in future versions of JavaScript

latedef.description: Prohibits the use of a variable before it was defined

maxerr.description: Maximum amount of warnings JSHint will produce before giving up

maxparams.description: Max number of formal parameters allowed per function

nocomma.description: Prohibits the use of the comma operator

nonew.description: Prohibits the use of constructors for side-effects (without assignment)

noreturnawait.description: Async functions resolve on their return value. In most cases, this makes returning the result of an AwaitExpression (which is itself a Promise instance) unnecessary

regexpu.description: Enables warnings for regular rexpressions which do not include the 'u' flag

shadow.description: Suppresses warnings about variable shadowing. i.e. declaring a variable that had been already declared somewhere in the outer scope

singleGroups.description: Prohibits the use of the grouping operator when it is not strictly required.

strict.description: Requires all code to run in ES5 strict mode

trailingcomma.description: Warns when a comma is not placed after the last element in an array or object literal

undef.description: Prohibits the use of explicitly undeclared variables

unused.description: Warns when you define and never use your variables

varstmt.description: Forbids the use of VariableStatements (`var`) in favor of `let` and `const`

boss.description: Suppresses warnings about the use of assignments in cases where comparisons are expected

debug.description: Suppresses warnings about the `debugger` statements in your code

elision.description: Tells JSHint that your code uses ES3 array elision elements, or empty elements

evil.description: Suppresses warnings about the use of `eval`

expr.description: Suppresses warnings about the use of expressions where normally you would expect to see assignments or function calls

lastsemic.description: Suppresses warnings about missing semicolons, but only when the semicolon is omitted for the last statement in a one-line block

loopfunc.description: Suppresses warnings about functions inside of loops

moz.description: Tells JSHint that your code uses Mozilla JavaScript extensions

noyield.description: Suppresses warnings about generator functions with no `yield` statement in them

scripturl.description: Suppresses warnings about the use of script-targeted URLs

supernew.description: Suppresses warnings about constructions like `new function () { ... };` and `new Object;`

validthis.description: Suppresses warnings about possible strict violations when the code is running in strict mode and you use `this` in a non-constructor function

withstmt.description: Suppresses warnings about the use of the `with` statement

shelljs.description: [Environment] Defines globals exposed by the ShellJS library

typed.description: [Environment] Defines globals for typed array constructors

globals.description: Specify a white list of global variables that are not formally defined in the source code

additionalProperties.description: Name of the global. Set to `true` for read/write, `false` for read-only.

extends.description: Specify the path to another configuration file to use as a base, relative to the current file

overrides.description: Specify the options that should only be applied to files matching a given path pattern

additionalProperties.description: The path pattern to apply the given options to

jshint.options.description: The jshint options object to provide args to the jshint command.

jshint.excludePath.description: A path to a file containing patterns describing which files and directories should be ignored by jshint. If the file exists it overrides jshint.exclude and any .jshintignore file.

jshint.exclude.description: Matching files and directories are being ignored by jshint. Glob patterns are interpreted relative to the workspace's root folder.

jshint.nodePath.description: Configures the path to the jshint module. Can be an absolute path or relative to the current directory.

jshint.packageManager.description: The package manager you use to install node modules.

jshint.trace.server.description: Traces the communication between VS Code and the jshint linter service.

scripts.compile: npm run compile:client && npm run compile:server
scripts.postinstall: cd jshint && npm install && cd ../jshint-server && npm install && cd ..
